channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dog poop again, 20th October
item.description:
I cleaned all the leafs myself last week so it’s clean not so dogs have a clean place to poo there needs to be enforcement on this Hackney is full of dog poo

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Richmond Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Spray tag on wall, 20th October
item.description:
Usual antisocial spray tagger has vandalised the pavement-fronting white/cream wall of Parish Mews. Looks like it's only recently been painted over, too, so he's obviously been back to reoffend in short space of time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Lane, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red traffic lights DANGEROUS, 20th October
item.description:
Last week you had someone working on the lights and since then they are stuck on red , cars are going through on the red light again I witnessed a very near accident this morning it is DANGEROUS! Drivers are beeping their horns day and night to force drivers through the red light
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bayswater Road, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car park and area round Morleys café overflowing with litter, 20th October
item.description:
I don’t know who has responsibility for the Sainsbury’s car park and outside of Morley, but it really is in a terrible state -if it is not the council responsibility, please could you follow up? I have taken pictures but don’t have a space to upload them here as this option hasn’t come up. The car park has been terrible for several months as is the entrance to the co-op car park - if the shops are responsible, they need to be informed of this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Albert Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cat litter and cat poo everywhere next to recycling bins, 20th October
item.description:
There a few bags of cat littler its a lot with cat or dog poo left next to the recycling bins.Its a health hazard attracting other animals and poo everywhere kid play near here its filthy and disgusting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham, London

item.title: Tree requires pruning/cutting back in front of 54 & 56 Woodhurst Avenue, 20th October
item.description:
Tree on pavement in front of 54 & 56 Woodhurst Avenue requires pruning/cutting back. It hasn’t been done for some time and has grown a lot bigger. Some branches now overhanging the front boundaries of 54 & 56. Branches also close to interfering with telephone lines. Is making the amount of leaves collecting on pavement & road worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodhurst Avenue, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter near bend in road nr venmead court, 20th October
item.description:
Generalised litter all along the street. I’ve been away for over two weeks and it doesn’t look like the road has been swept at all

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadworks on the corner of Delancy street & Albert st, 20th October
item.description:
We see that you have started work on this area, there was no notifcation of the works taking place, you have set up a diversion sign but after Albert street there are no signs, where does the diversion go?? As a person who lives on this street you have made it impossible to get in. the only access road we have is Mornington Street from Clarkson row or from the bridge. The least you could do is suspend the no vehicles on Mornington Street access. This is completely unaccetable from Camden to have approved this without notifiying anyone in the street. I know that a notification was not sent as i have spoken to quite a few neighbours, even those who live closest to the roadworks.. and there was nothing. please advise
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Delancey Street, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti now on the brick wall of subway under A2, 20th October
item.description:
There is graffiti on the painted walls in the foot tunnel under the A2, which is not unusual. However, they have now put huge graffiti on the actual brick walls of the foot tunnel at both entrances. When you walk from one side of the A2 to the other side, you look straight at the graffiti - its harder to get off the brick walls, and looks worse than the usual graffiti on the painted walls of the foot tunnel - we don't want them to start graffitiing the whole of the brick wall, which people can see from their homes along the A2

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Leechcroft Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Can someone ask the Trowbridge resident association group chair member & hackney Council housing manager Denise Corbin for an update on Osborne Road barrier gate lock being fixed.This is causing high levels of anti-social behavior due to unauthorized parking, illegal parking, no parking enforcements., 20th October
item.description:
Trowbridge resident association chair member posting on website but no updates since outdated information. Someone update the community with ETA of when gate is going to be fixed. This is causing anti-social behavior and illegal parking.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mallard Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
